scope_of_work.problem: Following annual H&S site inspection, it was found that during refit of Phase 1  Bridge Ops and Lits department ramps were not fitted with handrails or
scope_of_work.scope: Cut out section of existing carpet top and bottom of ramps and replace with supplied carpet tiles, supply and fit handrails complete with backboards if required, remove debris from site.

input.project_name: UPM-Fan Replacement Cooling Tower 3A LHS Twin
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: There 11 cooling towers on site at Kyndryl Warwick - 6 in Phase 1 supporting Phase 1 suites (Towers 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A & 3B) and 5 in Phase 1A now redundant. A specialist contractor (Baltimore Air Coil ) will be brought on site to remove the damaged left hand side, of the twin fan and shaft on PH1 3A and replace with new fans, shaft and bearings.
scope_of_work.scope:
•	Tower 3A will receive a pre-disinfection dose directly to the tower sump -0.5 litres of both ABT1 & ABT2. Tower pre-disinfection will be for 1 hour, minimum 
•	ABT1 & ABT2 levels are to be monitored and logged on the service report sheet. When an acceptable level has been achieved, these details are also recorded on the dynamic risk assessment service report sheet
•	CBRE with Baltimore Air Coil technicians in attendance will then make the necessary electrical isolations as per the approved FSP
•	CBRE with Baltimore Air Coil technicians in attendance will manually isolate the flow and return water valves positioned on the tower sump and on the return pipework on the top inspection platform. CBRE with WCS Group technicians in attendance will also isolate the Mains Water inlet valve to stop tower from filling
•	The Tower will then be drained to the dedicated foul drain using the drain off valve and sump pump
•	The faulty fan will then be stripped down and replaced with new fan shafts and bearings.
•	On completion of the fan repair, the other 2 fans on cooling tower 3A will be inspected for damage and where necessary, advise replacement.
•	After repair to the fan has been completed on the tower, Baltimore Air Coil technicians will, where applied, remove their locks and clasps and CBRE will run the fans and make sure all is ok. Once happy the tower shall be filled back to it’s appropriate levels.
•	The circulating water will be tested for bromine, ABT1 and ABT2 will be added to boost the level above 100ppm, the bromine level will be monitored every 15 minutes
•	Once acceptable the tower will be dosed with commissioning dose of inhibitor
•	On completion of the Tower post-disinfection CBRE will be informed so we can reinstate the electrical supply to the fans and pumps then sign off the permit to work relating to the Tower
scope_of_work.justification:
If the cooling tower is not repaired it cannot be used. The cooling towers are an integral piece of equipment for the resilience of PH1. With the warmer months approaching all cooling towers will run at maximum capacity. If not repaired the resilience off PH1 would be at 
risk.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
If the cooling tower is not repaired it cannot be used. The cooling towers are an integral piece of equipment for the resilience of PH1. With the warmer months approaching all cooling towers will run at maximum capacity. If not repaired the resilience off PH1 would be at 
risk.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: CSD2 GRP Enclosure has got cracks appearing on the roof and the seal externally and internal has perished in areas, which has started to allow water enter the enclosures.
scope_of_work.scope:
Reseal areas on roof that has started to show signs of damage.
Seal with sealant at low level GRP seal externally.
Seal internally of enclosure with sealant.
erect a access mobile platform for for working safely at height.
Replace Seals around doors.
fix an FR Tarpaulin over the external roof area of the enclosure and strap down.
scope_of_work.justification: CSD 2 Enclosure house's the Electrical Switchboards  for the DRUPS, this area covers the The STS within CSW, CSN, CSSE, CSA, CSD, are supplied by the Drups area and if any water ingress seeped into the switchgear it could cause a power failure. Also the area is controlled by fire suppression, and if their were a fire in CSD2, the fire suppression may not work as designed, due to the enclosure not being fully sealed, creating the chance of the gases to help dose the fire then may escape out of the damaged areas.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: CSD 2 Enclosure house's the Electrical Switchboards  for the DRUPS, this area covers the The STS within CSW, CSN, CSSE, CSA, CSD, are supplied by the Drups area and if any water ingress seeped into the switchgear it could cause a power failure. Also the area is controlled by fire suppression, and if their were a fire in CSD2, the fire suppression may not work as designed, due to the enclosure not being fully sealed, creating the chance of the gases to help dose the fire then may escape out of the damaged areas.

input.project_name: UPM-Ph1A AHU DX Control and Fan Failures
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The Ph1A AHU DX system provides cooling temperature control and humidification of air entering the DC suites. The AHU provides air change requirements and positive air pressure. Unit 3 had a control failure. This appro covers the specialist investigation and rectification works to reinstate the unit.
scope_of_work.scope: Investigation of fault, provision of fan replacements and relocation of DX sensors to improve the system control due to a history of  operation
scope_of_work.justification: The Ph1A AHU DX system provides cooling temperature control and humidification of air entering the DC suites. The AHU provides air change requirements and positive air pressure.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Reduced resilience in terms of temperature and humidity control in the data suites

input.project_name: UPM-HZ Installation of Chilled water iron filtration
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):rejected by Prof. Miracle Abshire (3):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Following high iron level identified in the chilled water system and the temporary scavsol filtration system at end of life and no longer supported by manufacturer and contractor. It is recommended that the unit is replaced with a better and current filtration system.
scope_of_work.scope:
To supply and install a 25 litre Boss X Pot to the LT CHW system in place of the current filtration system
Install pipework and valves
